maml:description.maml:para: Create a Win32Lob app in Intune
Use this command to upload an intunewin package to Microsoft Intune as a new Win32LobApp.
The App configuration you want to create
The .intunewin file that should be added to this app
Load the logo from file
Use a managed identity to connect to Intune
Use a token from another source to connect to Intune
Use a username to trigger interactive login or SSO
Specify the tenant ID, if you want to use another tenant then your home tenant
(optionally) Use a different client ID, apart from the default configured one.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specify the client secret, mandatory for Client Credentials flow. Loaded from `AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET`
Use default Azure Credentials from Azure.Identity to connect to Intune
Graph ID of the app to supersede
Override the name of the app in Intune
The folder where the package is

maml:description.maml:para: Get all apps from Intune packaged by WinTuner
Load apps from Tenant and filter based on Update Availabe, pipe to `New-IntuneWinPackage`
Use a managed identity to connect to Intune
Use default Azure Credentials from Azure.Identity to connect to Intune
Use a token from another source to connect to Intune
Use a username to trigger interactive login or SSO
Specify the tenant ID, optional for interactive, mandatory for Client Credentials flow. Loaded from `AZURE_TENANT_ID`
Specify the client ID, optional for interactive, mandatory for Client Credentials flow. Loaded from `AZURE_CLIENT_ID`
Specify the client secret, mandatory for Client Credentials flow. Loaded from `AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET`
Filter based on SupersedingAppCount
Filter based on SupersedingAppCount
Filter based on UpdateAvailable
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specify the client ID, optional for interactive, mandatory for Client Credentials flow. Loaded from `AZURE_CLIENT_ID`
Specify the client secret, mandatory for Client Credentials flow. Loaded from `AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET`
Filter based on SupersedingAppCount
Filter based on SupersedingAppCount
Specify the tenant ID, optional for interactive, mandatory for Client Credentials flow. Loaded from `AZURE_TENANT_ID`
Use a token from another source to connect to Intune
Filter based on UpdateAvailable
Use default Azure Credentials from Azure.Identity to connect to Intune
Use a managed identity to connect to Intune
Use a username to trigger interactive login or SSO
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all apps that have updates, using interactive authentication

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new IntuneWin package
This is a re-implementation of the IntuneWinAppUtil.exe tool, it's not feature complete use at your own risk.
The directory containing all the installation files
The main setupfile in the source directory
Destination folder
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Destination folder
The main setupfile in the source directory
The directory containing all the installation files
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-IntuneWinPackage -SourcePath C:\Temp\Source -SetupFile C:\Temp\Source\setup.exe -DestinationPath C:\Temp\Destination

dev:remarks.maml:para: Package all files in C:\Temp\Source, with setup file ..\setup.exe to the specified folder

maml:description.maml:para: Create intunewin file from Winget installer
Downloads the installer for the package and creates an `.intunewin` file for uploading in Intune.
The package id to download
The folder to store the package in
The version to download (optional)
The folder to store temporary files in

The folder to store the package in
The package id to download
The folder to store temporary files in
The version to download (optional)
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
